subject: Communication
title: The Backfire Effect
description: A fast breakdown of The Backfire Effect for builders.

hook.text: You show someone facts that contradict their belief. Instead of changing their mind, they believe harder.

buildup.text: The backfire effect means correcting misinformation can strengthen the original false belief.

discovery.text: When beliefs are tied to identity, facts feel like personal attacks. The brain defends beliefs like territory.

twist.text: This is why political debates rarely change minds. Each side hears the same facts and feels more right.

climax.text: To change beliefs, start with shared values â€” not opposing facts. People open up when they feel respected.

punchline.text: Facts don't change minds. Feelings of safety do.

quiz.question: What is the backfire effect?
options: Correcting misinformation can strengthen the false belief
